attributes.action: Provide funding for childcare for deployed members of UK Armed Forces.
attributes.background: Members of all three Services are currently deployed throughout the world. Many of these are parents, and deployment places an extra, unacknowledged burden on the families of personnel. We are asking for provision to be made for "respite" childcare allowances for all families with a deployed parent.
attributes.additional_details:
Longer Separation Allowance (LSA) is currently paid to service personnel regardless of their family situation. As parents nowadays are expected to do an equal share it is unfair to parents with a deployed partner(or indeed ex partner with whom they share custody) to shoulder extra deprivations because of their partner's deployment. We ask therefore for a scheme to continue family life without undue burden.
See https://www.facebook.com/Help-Forces-Parents-821717114627365/ for more information.

attributes.action: Make car parking charges illegal in or around public parks
attributes.background: For as long as I remember, most public parks were for families, friends, dog walkers and couples etc to enjoy the sceneries, taking walks, picnics or generally just feeding the ducks and birds. But more and more public places are now charging people to park.
attributes.additional_details: This is unfair now on people with little mobility, elderly and families that just wanted to spend a day out without having to pay. Places like Mote Park in Maidstone for example which has now started to charge parking fees. They justify this on the local government website by stating that this is to "keep it at the high standard residents and visitors have come to expect, as well as allowing for vital improvements". I am intrigued as to when they started to "keep it" at any standards.

attributes.action: Hillsborough families compensated in full for 27 years of legal fees.
attributes.background: The Hillsborough victims families have for 27 years had to pay their own legal fees unearthing the truth of what happened on 15/04/89. The South Yorkshire Police and others held responsible for the tragedy that day have had their legal fees paid by the tax payer. Another miscarriage of justice.
attributes.additional_details: The families of the 96 people who died at Hillsborough have had to endure 27 years of pain and heartache uncovering what they always knew was the truth. The families themselves and campaign groups have had to find exorbitant amounts of money to fund a fight that should never have had to be fought whilst the establishment have continued to fund their cover up and lies fully funded by the tax payer.

attributes.action: Request postponement of  KS1 SPAG test viewable to ALL online since 28/01/16!
attributes.background: The Government accidentally placed on line the official SPAG test that your children will take in May! This has been available to view and use since Jan 28th 2016!  Some children in the country have already used this as a practice paper so will be sitting that self same test for real! Invalid test!!

attributes.action: Stop Charging children born in the UK £936 to register as British Citizens
attributes.background: Charging Children born in the UK £936 whilst their parents hadn't been granted settlement at the time of their birth  to register as a British Citizen is against their fundamental human rights.Some parents with three children pay about £2,808 which is not right.
attributes.additional_details: Home Office Master Fees Leaflet 2016-03-08( B(OTA), B(OS) EM MN1, S2 S3T) Child under 18 applying to register as a British citizen pay £936. **An additional £80 per applicant is required to cover the ceremony fee should the child turn 18 during the application process. This will be required at point of decision.

attributes.action: Open a public inquiry into privately contracted benefit assessments by the DWP
attributes.background: Channel 4 Dispatches has revealed a systematic agenda to cut benefit payments by Capita, contracted for the DWP for Personal Independence Payment assessments alongside Atos. There is evidence to suggest systematic fraud and abuse of vulnerable adults by these companies. We call for a public inquiry.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.channel4.com/info/press/news/the-great-benefits-row-channel-4-dispatches

attributes.action: Increase fines and add 3 penalty points for illegally parking in disabled spaces
attributes.background: Abuse of Disabled parking keeps increasing. The disruption and physical pain of having to walk further because a non Blue Badge holder has taken a space, and those who use others badges because they want to get closer and not park further, now has to stop.
attributes.additional_details: Drivers only see the outside of a person, they dont feel the pain, or other effects that the so called invisible illness causes, which is why they were issued with the badge.  Drivers have not learnt the lesson and wont unless radical action is taken.  It it therefore proposed that any car owner without a badge or those who abuse a badge are fined not £60 but £300 and 3 points on the licence. The law is too leanient and has no effect. I ask everyone to support this MP's as well

attributes.action: Independent, more stringent scrutiny of MPs' interests, influences & conflicts
attributes.background: Need independent body with more stringent rules/codes on all historical, current & planned outside interests, potential influences & conflicts of interests, & their full declaration, so our elected/non-elected representatives work to the highest ethical & moral standards that engender public trust.
attributes.additional_details:
The PM & all MPs/candidates should be scrutinised by an independent body using more stringent, clear rules & do the honourable thing accordingly.

1.	Aim is to increase public trust in our democratic process & our politicians.
2.	Need to minimise conflicts of interest/influence that might bias MPs’ opinions, decisions, actions etc. (including investments, corporate/foreign deals, donations, second jobs, consultancies etc.); need full declarations at point of potential impact.
3.	Need transparency based on plain-English declarations of conflicts (not just posting tax returns that can hide all kinds of other investments/financial interests).

attributes.action: Crash for cash drivers to be banned from driving for life
attributes.background: Cash for crash scams are costing British drivers £400m a year in increased insurance premiums and putting everyone at risk of serious injury or death
attributes.additional_details:
Crash for cash costs British insurers £400m a year, that's £400m that you will have to pay through your increased insurance premiums.
It's only a matter of time before someone is seriously injured or killed by these maniacs. 
If they are British citizens then ban them for driving for life, if they are non-UK nationals then deport them and ban them from ever entering the UK.

attributes.action: Raise the issue of restitution with the Polish govt re WW2 confiscations
attributes.background: The Polish govt repeatedly refuses to pay compensation to all those whose property and chattels were confiscated during WW2

attributes.action: allow kids out of school for ten days per school year for holidays
attributes.background: Schools now fine us for taking kids out, the fine is often less than the savings made by taking a holiday during school term time so a fine isnt a deterrent.

attributes.action: Make domestic violence a crime in its own right with clear sentencing guidelines
attributes.background: The impact of domestic violence on victims and children and the financial and emotional cost to society is huge. Violence is rarely an isolated event but part of a campaign. Again and again, perpetrators walk free from court  or receive nominal sentences: proportionate justice for victims is rare.
attributes.additional_details: Watch BBC's Behind Closed Doors and consider how often the sentence actually fits the crime and achieves justice for victims of DV. See www.cps.gov.uk/legal/s_to_u/sentencing_manual for common assault, actual bodily harm and grievous bodily harm. Unless the assault breaks the skin or bones, highest charge is ABH, max sentence is 5 years, likely 3 or less, out in half the time, minus remand time: likely released from court or very shortly after. Impact on victims and children is lifelong.

attributes.action: Make companies legally obliged to allow staff time off work to donate blood
attributes.background: The government should legislate to make it a legal requirement for companies to give staff reasonable time off work to donate blood and other blood products, and staff should not lose salary, annual leave, other benefits or be required to make up lost time in doing so.
attributes.additional_details: Blood donations are vital to the NHS and save many lives every day. Yet getting time off work to donate blood can be very difficult. Employers are often reluctant to allow staff time out from their jobs for this purpose, meaning staff either have to use their annual leave entitlement, go unpaid, or make up the hours out of their own time. In a country which relies on blood donations every day this is a disgrace.

attributes.action: Remove reprimands from PNC records as soon as the offender turns into an adult.
attributes.background: Juveniles have previously been handed reprimands by Police as this was an easy and quick fix for them. However, this record stays until your 100th birthday and can have detrimental impact on your career, especially during vetting.
attributes.additional_details: I, myself have been in this predicament, when I applied to become a Police Constable and passed the rigorous recruitment process, only to be told that I failed my vetting due to a reprimand I received over 10 years ago and when I was a child, it was also disclosed on my application and I am sure other people have been penalised for this too!

attributes.action: Declare 8th May 'Attenborough Earth Day' to celebrate Sir David's 90th birthday
attributes.background: His love of the Natural World has inspired millions. This national day would celebrate his contribution and continue his aim to inspire the next generation to take care of our world by inviting us all to  do a little something to give back to the natural world

attributes.action: Make a it criminal offence for a dog to worry livestock, e.g mauling lambs
attributes.background: Dogs mauling lambs is becoming more frequent.  Not only is the devastation they wreak an economic loss to the farmer but it is also a welfare issue because of the distress it causes to the ewes that lose the lambs. They should at least be afforded the same level of protection by law as wild animals

attributes.action: Set a time scale for disabled people to get an answer and payment off pip. .
attributes.background: Pip payments are the new dla and the system is appalling. Disabled people are getting increasingly sicker whilst waiting for a decision. asos who make assessments have no available staff to make appropriate appointments and people are suffering waiting for help
attributes.additional_details: According to figures 725000 have claimed pip and there is no time scale in place so the disabled are left waiting and often deteriorating in health. This doesn't seem to matter. Disabled need to buy equipment and aids to enhance their lives and are often left bedridden whilst waiting an appointment. Carers are working free as they cannot access funds until pip is issued.this has become a tremendous strain on the sick and the unpaid overworked carers. It's not acceptable to the British people

attributes.action: Stop the bedroom tax in wales
attributes.background: a lot of people are and have lost their homes due to the bedroom tax family members die or move out of there family home to start new lives and that leaves families under size for the house they live in. then gets crippled with bedroom tax charges in social housing .
attributes.additional_details: people move out for social housing to rent private to avoid bedroom tax.This alone will cost hosing benefit more if they are claiming housing benefit has the rent is a lot more in private rent then social rent.So don't it make it cheaper and easier for the government to abolish bedroom tax? and maybe then people can afford to say in social housing where to rent cost much less and people would not need to ask for Discretionary Housing Payments then/ask for help with finding bonds for new housing

attributes.action: Give Ghurkas automatic citizenship.
attributes.background: Ghurkas are proud to serve this country and are a well respected members of the armed forces. Why should they have to apply for something and pay for it when they have already shown more loyalty to this country than some of the citizens who were born here.

attributes.action: Require all Members of Parliament to wear a uniform.
attributes.background: Given that some MPs are unable to behave with a maturity greater than that found in a year 8 classroom, they should be required, by law, to wear a uniform, whilst attending the House of Commons, to prevent bullying or harrassment on the basis of socioeconomic background and focus on their work.
attributes.additional_details:
In school, uniforms, prevent bullying, discrimination or otherwise mean behaviour by preventing children from being able to distinguish between each other on a socio-economic basis. Children of wealthy parents are unable to critique other children on the basis of the clothes they wear.

Since this behaviour is also found in the House of Commons it should be curbed by imposing a uniform, similar to ones found in schools across the country.

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-35651049

attributes.action: Make life sentences in prison proper life sentences.
attributes.background: I propose for life sentences in prison to mean proper life sentences in prison!! Not just life sentences but in fact all prison sentences. If you break the law you should do the punishment!!  Life should mean life, 20 years should mean 20 years etc.
attributes.additional_details:
I'm fed up hearing people getting slaps on the wrist or people being allowed out on day release and absconding. 

Time to put things right and make prisoners pay the price.

attributes.action: To reduce the TV license fee due to BBC taking a channel off air to save money
attributes.background: BBC announced that BBC 3 will be taken offline due to restructuring, as a result this means everyone will be paying for a channel that is only available online. Now until superfast broadband is all over that leaves a large proportion of people unable to watch online tv and overpaying for a service
attributes.additional_details:
See the failed BT Superfast Roll Out 
See BBC 3 (as its officially gone off-air to an online platform) 
Look at the statistics many families who do not have access to internet still have to pay a TV License fee which goes to the BBC

If the TV License fee was reduced that would free up capital for citizens to spend on other commodities and so could free up much needed money for the vunerable individuals and allow people to spend in other areas of the Economy and give the UK greater independance

attributes.action: I want compulsory and periodic Performance testing for Politicians.
attributes.background: We live in a society where everyone is constantly been Performance tested, our schools, our Hospitals, our local counsels our Police Forces, Fire Services. Teachers, Doctors, Soldiers and many other fantastic People.
attributes.additional_details:
Our Politicians are making the most important decisions in our Country today and every day, but are not subjected to the same performance measures that other institutions are, this needs to change. 
The Position as a Politician should only be filled by the highest of caliber person and constantly be performance tested to ensure the very best for our Great Country.

attributes.action: Publish forthwith details of devolving Sunday trading rules consultation replies
attributes.background: Consultation closed on 16 Sep 2015. Public and parliament have a legitimate expectation that the government will publish the detailed results before enacting associated legislation. To be credible any amendment to Sunday trading law must be strongly supported by the responses to the consultation.

attributes.action: should raise with the EU the denial of benefits to British workers in Norway
attributes.background: Some British workers, despite being members of the Norwegian National Insurance Scheme are denied benefits on the grounds they are not registered as living in Norway. These workers cannot receive benefits anywhere and fail The Habitual Residency Test when they return to the UK seeking medical care
attributes.additional_details: Despite the EEA Agreement and bilateral treaties between the UK and Norway on health, social security and tax, by denying (in contravention of EU Regulation 1408/71 Article 13(2)(c) applied to Norway by virtue of Annex VI of the EEA Agreement) residence permits to EU citizens, Norway used the pretext EU citizens, members of the Norwegian National Insurance Scheme could receive no benefits on the grounds they were not registered as living in Norway even if they were "tax liable" to Norway

attributes.action: Make people who claim Job Seekers Allowance do volunteering work
attributes.background: Please don't view this as an out of touch 50 year old something living in Kent ranting and fuming about how people these days don't do anything. I am sure that people claiming the allowance are literally just trying to find a job, and getting by on what they can, however it's a matter of principle.
attributes.additional_details: At time of writing (26/01/2016) there are 760,000 people claiming JSA, that is essentially three quarters of a million people ready to work on state projects, man food banks, and help towards the state. Obviously how this would be implemented would be up to the government, but just me thinking out loud.

attributes.action: Let UK government review its non-skilled work rule for tier 4 dependants
attributes.background: The UK government certainly has more mechanisms to compel tier 4 immigrants to return to their countries upon completion of studies than painfully separating family members. The decision to disallow dependants of tier 4 students from taking low-paying jobs is unnecessarily separating families.
attributes.additional_details: I'm a tier 4 UK resident registered for a PhD programme. My wife is a nursery school teacher in Nigeria but I'm afraid she may not be able to get the same level of job in the UK. The new visa rule which implies she couldn't take low-paying jobs in the UK means if she comes to the UK, she won't be able to support my scholarship stipends to sustain our family. The trauma we have experienced within the little period of separation means our life cannot continue like this.

attributes.action: 20 million pound hand outs to teach English. Give it to support the homeless
attributes.background: David Cameron has announced the government is putting aside 20 million pounds to help teach English to foreigner's. Instead help our homeless that are freezing on our streets.
attributes.additional_details: That money could help buy sleeping bags and blankets and open more shelters. That's the difference between life and death not teaching English to people already living in there nice houses with government handouts already.

attributes.action: Remove all of G4S Prison Contracts.
attributes.background:
I watched the panorama expose on Medway training centre I am appalled at the way G4S handle prisoners
They make a profit from people's incarceration which is both immoral and not in the public interest
I was a Public Prison Officer for 17 years and never acted anything other than professionally

attributes.action: Ban Zambian Information Minister Chishimba Kambwili For Inciting Tribalism
attributes.background:
Zambian Chief Government Spokesperson Chishimba Kambwili has been promoting Tribalism & maligning other tribes. If no  measures are taken he can plunge this country into genocide. we have  Audio/video recording.
May the British government & its allies to ban this man from entering the country.
attributes.additional_details:
- Read more at: 
http://lusakavoice.com/2015/04/25/kambwili-accused-of-promoting-tribalism/
https://www.facebook.com/permalink.php?story_fbid=1621557574727364&id=1448027348747055&substory_index=0
http://zambiareports.com/2015/07/08/zambians-are-united-and-above-tribalism-kambwili/
http://www.zambiawatchdog.com/dont-judge-me-chishimba-kambwili/
http://zambia.news24.com/National-News/Southern-province-secession-talks-fueled-by-tribalism-reports-20150709

attributes.action: Change Universal Credits to help the newly self employed
attributes.background:
Universal credits for the self employed is only available in limited parts of the UK and people are advised to use working tax and housing benefits if not in these areas.

Due to this new business owners are left with no income when trying to match their overheads in their starting months.
attributes.additional_details:
There are many new businesses starting every day with help from government bodies such as the Princes trust but there are no options available to these businesses for help with living costs or travel which can result on debt and loss of business

The age gap on working tax credits and the restrictions on benefits available I have personally been left with £0 of benefits available to me regardless of working 40 hours  and having no incoem or takings  to support myself. 

Thank you for reading.

attributes.action: Medical staff to be prosecuted for negligence which results in death
attributes.background: Thousands of patients are dying in hospitals due to medical negligence and neglect and families are not getting justice,. Money is not justice. Change the law so that those responsible can be prosecuted which will make them more aware of the consequences of their actions.

attributes.action: We want to delay invoking Article 50 of the Lisbon treaty for at least 3 years
attributes.background: We believe the outcome of the EU Referendum was too close, with almost half over the electorate not wanting to leave the EU, that further investigation of the risks and changes that will occur to the UK need to be studied and popularised with debate and, if necessary more voting processes.
attributes.additional_details:
1) According to Google, “What is the EU?” is the 2nd most searched term about the EU since the announcement of the historic Brexit referendum. In the hours prior to the vote, Google says one of the top questions was “What is Brexit?”. This ignorance will likely cause further dismay to the millions in Britain who are understandably concerned about the massive uncertainty created by Thursday’s vote. 

2) Lack of any plan and renouncing of 'facts' by the biggest voices in the 'leave' campaign.

attributes.action: Allow Tunbridge Wells a referendum to separate from the UK alongside Scotland.
attributes.background:
Tunbridge Wells voted in favour of remaining as part of the EU against the trend of the rest of the country.

Please allow Tunbridge Wells an independence referendum (along the lines of the inevitable Scottish Referendum for independence) so that it can renegotiate itself back into the EU.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory to display a halal food sign in businesses serving halal food.
attributes.background: All businesses serving halal food should clearly display a sign at the entrance of their establishment stating that the food they serve is halal. This would allow people of the Muslim faith to clearly identify where they are permitted to eat and Sikhs to identify where they cannot eat.

attributes.action: Give young people of 13 years and over the right to vote in referenda.
attributes.background: I am 13.  People of my age will have to live with the decisions that adults made for us for years to come.  We need a say.  Young people are just as engaged as adults.  We have access to social media and information, and we take it in.  We want to secure our own futures.

attributes.action: Referendum on full access to EU single market before invoking Article 50.
attributes.background: Whilst respecting the EU Referendum result the Leave Campaign failed to definitively address with the electorate the issue of access to the single market. This petition seeks to ensure that full access is negotiated before Article 50 is invoked. If this cannot be achieved a referendum must be held.

attributes.action: Raise the age of voting to 25
attributes.background: It would appear that too many young people between the ages of 18 and 25 are being persuaded about their political decisions by uneducated pop stars and celebrities. therefore only persons over 25 should have the political mandate.
attributes.additional_details:
Bob Geldorf, had a few hit records and now extols the advantages of remaining in the EU. With no expertise in how the EU works or any political office of his own. is also not a British citizen

Bono, had some hit records and now extols the advantages of remaining in the EU. With no expertise in how the EU works or any political office of his own. is also not a British citizen

attributes.action: Increase NHS and science research funding by £350 million per week
attributes.background: The leave campaign promised to redirect the money spent on EU membership to UK priorities, such as NHS and science funding. They should honour this promise, and increase funding for the NHS and science research by £350 million per week, which is what is spent by the UK on EU membership.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.voteleavetakecontrol.org/campaign - evidence that voters were promised increased funding for the NHS and science research by the leave campaign.

attributes.action: A life-time ban from politics, and punishment, for MPs that renege on promises.
attributes.background: We propose a life ban from politics for MPs who do not enact all manifesto promises - or those implied in slogans.  Also a fine or imprisonment for 'perjury to abuse public trust'. Party funds used for such campaigns should be forcibly recovered to fund a watchdog body against future such abuses.
attributes.additional_details: Whatever you voted, the decision to leave the EU is a chance for Britain to fix its democracy.  In elections, and now in the referendum, politicians make campaign promises in order to win votes, only to u-turn or deny making those promises. It mocks the principles of democracy. Now is a chance to write into law an insurance against such deception. This law would put an end to 'career politics' and remind all elected representatives that they work for the electorate, not their own agendas.

attributes.action: Implement a 2nd EU Referendum allowing 14-17 year olds to vote
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon the HM Government to debate and implement a second referendum allowing 14-17 year olds to vote as the results effect everyone not only voters aged 18 and over.

attributes.action: Referendum on making London a principality with right to remain in the EU
attributes.background: Following the overwhelming support from London voters for the UK to remain in the EU, we request that HM Government consider the option to allow London (as a principality of the U.K.) to remain in the EU - if necessary, following a second referendum/London-only vote.

attributes.action: Make London, Northern Ireland and Scotland an independent EU state.
attributes.background: The Majority of Scotland, Northern Ireland and London have voted to remain in the UK. So I ask Parliament to hold a referendum to make London Northern Ireland and Scotland a separate state of the European Union.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence as per EU Referendum results in press.

attributes.action: A referendum to decide whether Norwich should become an independent nation.
attributes.background: After the result of the European Referendum, particularly the result in Norwich, we believe that Norwich has the infrastructure to become an independent nation, separate from the UK. After years of neglect from Westminster, Norwich has a better chance of growth if we leave the UK.

attributes.action: Allow the area within the M25 to secede from the UK and remain part of the EU.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, believe the results of the EU referendum highlight irreconcilable differences between those living within the M25 and those outside of it.  Accordingly, we wish to secede from the UK so that we can have our (sane) vote to remain part of the EU respected.
attributes.additional_details: We invite those areas of the UK that voted to remain to join us and become part of a new commonwealth of the enlightened.

attributes.action: Create new Special Economic Zone for London, NI & Scotland which remains in EU
attributes.background: Although a majority of the UK voted to leave the EU a large majority of those in London, NI and Scotland voted to remain. These areas will suffer the most from the UK leaving the EU. Special Economic Zones have been created in many countries, including China, with much success.
attributes.additional_details:
We know the EU isn't perfect and needs radical reform but for many in the UK that doesn't mean we should leave it. This petition requests that the creation of a Special Economic Zone is discussed in Parliament. This Zone would remain a member of the EU and contain London, and perhaps other interested contiguous regions.

This SEZ would enable these regions to continue trading from within the EU thereby fostering increased trade, investment and job creation.

attributes.action: Bristol to receive a referendum to leave the UK and form an independent Nation
attributes.background: After vote leave won we believe that the United Kingdom does not speak or represent Bristol anymore and believe it better to move in a different direction from the UK

attributes.action: A referendum for Independence for London, and the South East England Counties.
attributes.background: On the 23rd of June 2016 the United Kingdom voted to leave the EU. London & South East of England thrive on European trade and intrinsic links to global wealth and trade that it brings.
attributes.additional_details: On the 23rd of June 2016 the United Kingdom held a referendum to on Europe. The local economies of "L&SE" (London and the South East) are driven by our intrinsic links to global trade and global wealth, and services to be provided around this. The EU is a vital component of these links.

attributes.action: Make a ban on using plastic packaging for fruit and veg.
attributes.background: Bring back paper bags and cardboard containers for fruit and vegetables. The amount of plastic waste generated annually in the UK is estimated to be nearly 3 million tonnes. An estimated 56% of all plastics waste is used packaging, three-quarters of which is from households. Free the cucumber!

attributes.action: Have all religious institutions in the UK declare their source of funding.
attributes.background: In wake of the countless terror attacks occurring on European soil, the issue of radicalisation of people in the UK is an increasingly important issue. To help combat this issue all religious institutions should declare where they receive their funding and who the recipients of their charity are.
attributes.additional_details:
After sources revealing the situation in Germany regarding approximately 200 mosques offered to be built by the Saudi Government (one I find deplorable in how it acts), I feel that it is time to see where mosques in Great Britain get their funding from and where their charity goes and whether it goes to funding extremism or not.

This petition also applies to religious institutions of other faiths as this is more than possible.
